thread.title: Air Malta offers free massages to economy class passengers from Gatwick Airport
thread.title_full: Air Malta offers free massages to economy class passengers from Gatwick Airport | Daily Mail Online

author: Katie Amey for MailOnline
title: Air Malta offers free massages to economy class passengers from Gatwick Airport
text:
26 shares 5
View
comments
Air Malta may have just introduced the most luxurious economy class perk in the sky.
The Mediterranean country's national carrier is pampering passengers in its lower class with massages - a service that most first class travellers will never get to experience.
Relaxing head rubs and hand massages are now being delivered free of charge.
Air Malta will now be offering head, neck and foot massages to economy class passengers from Gatwick
On flights between London Gatwick Airport and Malta, two professional therapists will welcome those on board with various product samples and personalised head, neck and foot massages.
RELATED ARTICLES Previous 1 Next 'He had a big hole in his belly': Tourist stabbed with... The long way around: Couple and their pet cat who travelled... Trio banned from airline for one of the 'worst cases' of... Brave tourist rescues drowning dog after two powerful waves... Share this article Share 26 shares The service, called 'Sky Spa', began on flights KM116 and KM117 last week.
Passengers also receive Myoka Spas vouchers for €20 (£14) and listen to relaxing music through headphones.
The service, called 'Sky Spa', began on Air Malta flights KM116 and KM117 last week
According to the airline, the 'Sky Spa' will be available on select flights, in partnership with the local spa brand Myoka Spas.
Air Malta also says that this sort of offering is 'just the beginning' and similar projects to enhance the customer experience will be launching in the near future.
The carrier announced the launch of the partnership on its Twitter account.
